thread.title: Toronto could break a high temperature record today - Toronto - CBC News
thread.title_full: Toronto could break a high temperature record today - Toronto - CBC News

title: Toronto could break a high temperature record today - Toronto - CBC News
text:
Updated Toronto could break a high temperature record today Environment Canada says the city could break its previous temperature record for Feb. 23, which as 14.9 C By Andrea Janus, CBC News Posted: Feb 23, 2017 5:36 AM ET Last Updated: Feb 23, 2017 9:18 AM ET Spring-like weather is in store for Thursday. (David Donnelly/CBC) Related Stories Toronto just crushed a February high temperature record 
With just a few weeks until spring, it would seem that Mother Nature is getting a jump on the next season, as Toronto could reach record-high temperatures on Thursday. 
Environment Canada is calling for a high of 16 C today, with a 60 per cent chance of showers or drizzle. It is expected to stay cooler near Lake Ontario. 
The normal high for Feb. 23 is 1 C. 
The highest recorded temperature for this date was back in 1984, when the temperature reached 14.9 C, according to Environment Canada. 
Patchy fog overnight. Showers possible my morning. Sky clears gradually tmrw afternoon with record breaking temps possible (14-16°C range). pic.twitter.com/wTTZJQJTLc — @JayScotland 
As of 8 a.m., it was 13 C in the city. 
The temperature will drop to a low of 2 C overnight, with the risk of a thunderstorm before morning. 
Friday's high will reach 4 C before another spike on Saturday, with a forecast high of 12 C. 
The warm weather follows an unseasonably balmy Family Day weekend, when another temperature record fell. On Saturday, the high of 11.6 C beat the previous high for Feb. 18 of 10.8 C.
